item.title: Brute Force
item.description: What is Brute Forcing? A brute-force problem is exactly what it sounds like: simply doing everything possible to eventually reach the answer. Let’s say you were trying to achieve the password to someone’s phone (assume 4 digits from 0 to 9). A brute force solution would be to try every single password possible. This way, it is guaranteed that at one point, the answer would be correct. Pros Easy/Uncomplicated Guarantees a solution Cons Inefficient Not suitable for every problem Brute Force in the USACO It is almost guaranteed that there will be at least one brute force problem in a USACO Bronze contest, and sometimes there will be 2 (and rarely 3).
